build i021, winxp, j9sc20031212

I tried to start a runtime workbench and I got the stack trace below. Turns out
I had been modifying org.eclipse.core.runtime's manifest.mf file and I had made
a typo. (I had put an extra comma at the end of a package export line)

1). there is a typo in the below msg. ("in invalid" should be "is invalid")
2). can we get a better error message telling me what to do? maybe more context?

absolutely.  assigning to Rafael for inclusion in M7

The IllegalArgumentException is misleading. I changed StateObjectFactoryImpl to
just let the BundleException be thrown.

The problematic messages are in the framework message catalog (see
MANIFEST_INVALID_* entries). Most of them do not make clear that it is an error
in a bundle manifest. Also, the ManifestElement class does not make difference
between errors parsing package/bundle names. For instance, an error parsing a
host bundle will say that the package description is invalid.

Adding Thomas for comments/further action.
Moving to Thomas (as a more effective reminder <g>) for comments/further action.
I have checked into HEAD some improved messages for bad manifests.
